devdoc.details: Oracle contract returns a price set by the oracle contract owner. The owner can change the base price. The price is inversely proportional to the natural logarithm of the username length and is multiplied by the duration.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

price(uint256,uint8).details: The function reverts if the username length is less than 3. The base price is returned if the username length is exactly 3.

params.durationInYears: The duration in years for which the price is calculated.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.newBasePrice: The new base price to be set.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: Oracle

price(uint256,uint8).notice: Calculates and returns the price for a username based on its length and duration. The price is determined by the natural logarithm of the username length and is inversely proportional to the length.

setBasePrice(uint256).notice: Allows the owner to set a new base price.
